Dear Ms. Taylor:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at 616-204-6992.

Sincerely,
Stephanie S Meeuwenberg, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 3/18/24, youth attempted to walk off site and staff followed.
During this incident youth would be assaultive towards staff. Youth
was put in a restraint more than once and continued to be
assaultive. A staff responded by picking youth up and slamming
him on the ground. Youth laid on the ground crying and was
concerned he had broken ribs. Law enforcement and EMS were
called. He was taken for medical evaluation and no trauma was
determined.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on March
19, 2024, in collaboration with Law Enforcement and the
MDHHS worker. Youth A said on March 18, 2024, he was tired of
being on the unit and decided to go for a walk on the trail, around
the gym, and by the entry booth. Youth A said a Staff 4 and Youth
B were following him around outside until Staff 1 showed up.
Youth A said Staff 1 told Staff 4 to take Youth B and go back to the
unit. Youth A said Staff 2 showed up and Staff 3 pulled up in her
car but did not get out. Youth A said he began to walk away when
Staff 1 took ahold of his arm saying, “it’s cold, I want body heat”,
walking with him. Youth A said Staff 2 suddenly took his other arm
and Staff 1 and Staff 2 placed him in a restraint. Youth A said he
screamed “stop touching me” and sat down. Youth A said Staff 2
2

grabbed his sweatshirt, so he stood back up and Staff 2 took hold
of the front pocket of the sweatshirt and ripped it. Youth A said that
made him upset and he ran off to the front of the gym with Staff 1
and Staff 2 following him on foot and Staff 3 still in the car
watching. Youth A said Staff 1 and Staff 2 attempted to restrain
him, however he went to the ground, so they let go and he began
to punch Staff 2 in the penis. Youth A said he stood up and
punched Staff 2 and Staff 2 grabbed both of his legs, picked him
up four feet in the air, and “slammed” him to the ground. Youth A
said he was in immediate pain on his back and right side and
thought he was going to lose consciousness. Youth A said Staff 2
got up and said, “I quit” and walked away. Youth A said Staff 2 and
Staff 3 witnessed the incident and called an ambulance and he
went to the hospital for an examination. Youth A said this was the
only time Staff 2 had ever been aggressive with him, stating he
has never had any issues with Staff 2. Youth A said he saw one
other time when Staff 2 was aggressive to another youth, stating
Staff 2 picked up Youth C about two or three months ago in the
gym and “slam him to the ground”. Youth A said he did not know
why this occurred however stated it was the exact same way Staff
2 had slammed him to the ground.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on March
19, 2024, in collaboration with Law Enforcement and the
MDHHS worker. Youth B said yesterday Youth A went outside
without permission and he was with Staff 4 who had been
following Youth A briefly. Youth B said Staff 1 and Staff 2 arrived
and he and Staff 4 started to walk back to the unit. Youth B said he
saw Youth A “swinging” on Staff 2 but never saw Staff 2 pick Youth
A up or slam him to the ground. Youth B said interactions he saw
were by the “booth” and Staff 2 was “handling things
appropriately”.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on March
19, 2024, in collaboration with Law Enforcement and the
MDHHS worker. Youth C said he has been restrained but not
often. Youth C said no staff have ever done anything they are not
supposed to do during a restraint. Youth C said Staff 2 has
restrained him, denying Staff 2 ever hurt him during a restraint or
slammed him to the ground. Youth C said he has never seen Staff
2 do anything he should get into trouble for, noting Staff 2 is a
good staff that “is really nice”. Youth C said Staff 2 will often bring
in video games for the youth to play and will joke around with the
youth.
3

Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on March
19, 2024, in collaboration with Law Enforcement and the
MDHHS worker. Staff 1 said she is a supervisor at Clarence
Fischer Center. Staff 1 said she was called for assistance with
Youth A as he had walked out of the unit. Staff 1 said she caught
up to Youth A by the entry driveway, who was being followed by
Staff 4 and Youth B. Staff 1 said she instructed Staff 4 to take
Youth B and go back to the unit. Staff 1 said she began to follow
Youth A and talk with him. Staff 1 said Staff 2 arrived and started
to talk to Youth A as well. Staff 1 said she asked Youth A to “share
body heat” and took Youth A’s arm while walking stating “it is cold
out here” as a gesture to calm him down and hopefully get him to
walk back to the unit. Staff 1 said Youth A started to walk in the
direction of the unit and then tried to run, pushing Staff 2 who was
walking next to him. Staff 1 said she and Staff 2 went into a team
high restraint, with each staff on either side of Youth A’s body,
however Youth A dropped to the ground, so they released Youth A.
Staff 1 said Youth A stood back up and began making comments
about being stronger than Staff 2 and was pushing him. Staff 1
said Staff 2 did not seem upset about the comments and
continued to encourage Youth A to go back inside. Staff 1 said
Youth A again tried to run away from them and Staff 2 had a hold
of Youth A’s sweatshirt pocket and it ripped. Staff 1 said she and
Staff 2 followed Youth A to the gym and Youth A sat at a picnic
table. Staff 1 said Youth A was upset and began to push and
punch Staff 2 and they attempted to place Youth A in another
restraint however staff were not able to get a proper hold of Youth
A. Staff 1 said Staff 2 then grabbed Youth A in a “bear hug” and
picked him up so his feet were off the ground and put him to the
ground on his back. Staff 1 said Youth A started to cry stating his
ribs hurt and Staff 2 said “this is bullshit’ and walked off. Staff 1
said an ambulance was called and Youth A was brought to the
emergency room for an examination. Staff 1 said the incident
happened very fast however she felt it should have been
prevented by Staff 2 controlling himself and using the techniques
they are trained to use. Staff 1 said this behavior was out of
character for Staff 2 as he was clearly agitated, and she has never
seen him like that previously. Staff 1 said Staff 3 was present and
witnessed the incident.
Staff 2 was called on April 10, 2024, and April 16, 2024, he did
not answer his phone or return the phone calls. The DHHS
worker was able to interview him with his attorney on April 15,
2024. The interview is as follows:
A face-to-face contact was made with Staff 2 at his attorney's
office in Saginaw. Staff 2 questioned if he was terminated from
4

Wolverine Human Services, stating he thought he was placed on
administrative leave pending the outcome of the investigation.
Staff 2 denied quitting and said no one from Wolverine has
contacted him since. When asked if he turned in his keys, Staff 2
denied this. Staff 2 did the say night of the incident, he said he
was done and left for the night. Staff 2 then noted he didn't think
he would be going back to Wolverine to work, even if they allowed
him to. Staff 2 said he worked there for eight years and was a
youth shift supervisor for four of those years. Staff 2 denied there
being any discipline in his employee file. Staff 2 said the incident
on March 18, 2024, happened around 7:00 p.m. or 8:00 p.m. near
the gym. Staff 2 said Youth A was upset for some reason but
wouldn't say why. Staff 2 said Youth A became physical with him
and Staff 1. Staff 2 said Youth A began pushing and shoving them,
so they placed him in a restraint. Staff 2 said this was a high-level
restraint which meant he and Staff 1 were on either side of Youth
A, holding each arm and bending him forward. Staff 2 said they
tried to restrain Youth A several times, stating he thought they tried
four times. Staff 2 said Youth A punched him in the mouth and he
told Staff 1 they were going to restrain him again. Staff 2 said he
feels Staff 1 was scared because she didn't try and restrain him
and when he grabbed Youth A’s arm, Youth A pulled them both to
the ground. Staff 2 said after they fell, he got up and walked off.
Staff 2 denied Youth A had hit him anywhere else, including the
groin area. Staff 2 described Youth A's hand as being a closed fist.
Staff 2 said his lip was a little swollen after being hit but denied it
bled or he needed medical attention. Staff 2 described Youth A
pulling him to the ground by one arm. Staff 2 said they were
standing on grass, not pavement which made it more slippery.
Staff 2 said he was wearing Nike shoes and couldn't keep his
balance. Staff 2 noted he fell on top of Youth A, and he
immediately got up, walked off and left for the night. Staff 2
denied knowing if Youth A was crying or injured. Staff 2 admitted
to being frustrated with Youth A after being punched in the mouth.
Staff 2 said he and Youth A had a good relationship with one
another prior to the incident. Staff 2 said the entire thing surprised
him because he typically could calm Youth A down. Staff 2 denied
Youth A ever being physical with him before. Staff 2 said there
have been times where Youth A was almost placed in a restraint,
but not because they were able to talk it out. Staff 2 said he
wasn't sure if what happened was on camera, stating they were
outside. Staff 2 couldn't remember what staff he switched out with
at the beginning. Staff 2 denied bear hugging Youth A, denied
picking him off of the ground and denied slamming him onto the
ground.
5

Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on March
27, 2024, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 3 said
she was driving back to the facility after having been on a break
and saw Staff 1 and Staff 2 near the booth at the entrance of the
facility with Youth A. Staff 3 said Youth A is currently on a safety
plan for suicidal behaviors. Staff 3 said she does not have the best
relationship with Youth A and felt if she were to intervene it would
escalate Youth A further, noting it appeared Staff 1 and Staff 2 had
things “under control”. Staff 3 said she stayed in her car following
Staff 1, Staff 2, and Youth A from a distance. Staff 3 said Youth A
was walking around the facility. Staff 3 said she saw Staff 1 and
Staff 2 place their hands on Youth A’s back and were talking with
him. Staff 3 said Youth A continued to walk away and once near
the medical building Youth A began to elbow and push staff, so
they attempted to place him in a team control restraint with one
staff on either side of Youth A however Youth A fell to the ground
and staff disengaged. Staff 3 said Youth A laid on the ground for a
few minutes and then got up and started to run towards the gym
with Staff 1 and Staff 2 following him. Staff 3 said Youth A sat on a
bench and Staff 1 and Staff 2 stood talking to him. Staff 3 said
neither Staff 1 or Staff 2 appeared to be upset based on their body
language and stances. Staff 3 said Youth A started to hit and kick
Staff 2 and Staff 1 and Staff 2 attempted another team control
however once again Youth A went to the ground, so staff
disengaged. Staff 3 said Youth A got back up and hit Staff 2 in his
groin. Staff 2 jumped backwards from Youth A. Staff 3 said Youth A
then punched Staff 2 in the face twice with a closed fist, at which
point she got out of her car and started to walk towards them. Staff
3 said Staff 2 “wrapped [Youth A] up” and they “tussled” and
ended up on the ground. Staff 3 said she cannot say if Staff 2
intentionally slammed Youth A to the ground however noted that
Youth A’s feet were about one to two inches off the ground and
Youth A hit the ground “hard”. Staff 3 said she was yelling to “stop”
and “let him go” to Staff 2 while she was walking up on the
situation, but it was too late. Staff 3 said Youth A had landed on his
back with Staff 2 over top of him. Staff 3 said Youth A started to
complain of his ribs hurting and was crying. Staff 3 said Staff 2 got
up and said he was “done”, and she told him to go home for the
night which he did. Staff 3 said she has been Staff 2’s supervisor
and he does not have previous issues with being aggressive with
youth. Staff 3 said the ambulance was called and Youth A was
taken to the hospital for an examination.
Documents Reviewed:
• MiSACWIS Incident Reports for Youth A:
6

o Incident Report 177600234 dated March 18, 2024,
7:18pm. The incident report explains the first
restraint with Youth A near the gymnasium due to
Youth A attempting to punch Staff 2. The report is
consistent with Staff 1’s interview.
o Incident Report 177600235 dated March 18, 2024,
7:23pm. The incident report explains the second
restraint with Youth A near the gym prior to him
running to the picnic table. The restraint was due to
Youth A pushing Staff 2 and is consistent with Staff
1’s interview.
o Incident Report 177600236 dated March 18, 2024,
7:25pm. The incident report explains the third
attempted restraint with Youth A by the gym due to
Youth A punching and kicking Staff 2. The incident
report explains the behaviors of Staff 2 and him
lifting Youth A off the ground and putting him on the
ground on his back. The report is consistent with
Staff 1 and Staff 3’s interviews.
• Medical Records for Youth A from McLaren Caro
Community Hospital dated March 18, 2024. The records
report Youth A being seen for right-sided rib pain due to
being slammed to the ground by a staff member. Youth A
was given an x-ray which noted “The right thoracic cage
appears unremarkable. No rib fracture identified.” The
report stated “At this point in time patient has likely
contusion. Recommended ICE, Motrin and rest.”
• Staff 2’s personnel file: Staff 2 was up to date on his
restraint training. There were five disciplinary actions not
related to being aggressive with youth and on March 19,
2024, Staff 2 was terminated for throwing Youth A to the
ground.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance with Intervention Standards
and Prohibitions. The youth and two staff report Staff 2 picked
Youth A up off the ground and put him down on the ground on his
back in a forceful manner.
Technical Assistance:
Technical Assistance was offered for the facility to retrain staff on
the use of emergency restraint as a lifesaving response to protect
the youth or others of unanticipated or severely aggressive
behavior that places the youth or others at serious threat of
violence or injury if not immediate intervention occurs.
Consultation:
7

Consultation was provided that holding onto youth’s clothes
should not be utilized and staff should be educated on this.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2023C0000074 dated 1/18/2023, CAP Approved 2/24/2023
SIR 2023C0000496 dated 8/8/2023, CAP Approved 8/29/2023
SIR 2024C0000928SI dated 1/3/2024, CAP Approved 2/1/2024
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.

sir_summary.summary: A youth at Clarence Fischer Center attempted to walk off-site, leading to a physical altercation with staff. During multiple attempts to restrain the youth, Staff 2 forcefully picked him up and slammed him to the ground, causing the youth pain and requiring a hospital evaluation. The facility was found in noncompliance with rules prohibiting physical punishment, and this was a repeat violation. The investigation substantiates that Staff 2 bears direct culpability for using prohibited, excessive force.

sir_violation_level.justification: The substantiated violation involved staff-on-youth violence, specifically Staff 2 picking up Youth A and slamming him to the ground with sufficient force to cause pain requiring medical evaluation, in violation of rules prohibiting hitting, striking, or pushing a youth. This aligns with the 'Severe SIRs' category for 'Safety and Violence' incidents and also falls under 'Restraint and seclusion' for excessive force/unsafe de-escalation.
